alert.note: Alert for Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 3:55PM CDT until April 17 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. Significant amounts of snow still remain in the higher elevations of Bayfield county that will continue to melt. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following area, northern Bayfield county. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. County, township and forest roads may flood, especially in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 PM CDT, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Lost Creek Number One, Pikes Creek, Little Sioux River, Lenawee Creek, Pine Creek, Raspberry River, Flag River, East Fork Cranberry River, Onion River, Red Cliff Creek, Cranberry River, Fourmile Creek, Bono Creek, Siskiwit River, Little Pine Creek, Whittlesey Creek, Sand River, North Pikes Creek, Bark River, North Fish Creek, Lost Creek Number Three, East Fork Flag River, Superior, Lake, Sioux River and Thompson Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washburn, Barksdale, Bayfield, Cornucopia, Bayfield Peninsula Sea Caves, Sand Bay, Herbster, Red Cliff, Red Cliff Reservation and Apostle Islands National Lake Shore. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads in hilly terrain. Find an alternate route. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
